Cookie Policy

Last updated: August 19, 2025

1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners about how users interact with their sites.

PersonalitySpark uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience, provide personalized content, and analyze website traffic.

2. Types of Cookies We Use

Essential Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled. They include:

  • Session cookies to maintain your quiz progress
  • Security cookies to prevent fraud and ensure safe browsing
  • Preference cookies to remember your settings (theme, language)

Analytics Cookies

We use analytics cookies to understand how visitors use our website:

  • Google Analytics: Helps us analyze website traffic and user behavior
  • Performance monitoring: Tracks page load times and technical performance
  • User interaction: Records how users interact with quizzes and content

Advertising Cookies

These cookies are used to deliver relevant advertisements:

  • Journey MV: Our advertising partner for monetization
  • Google AdSense: For displaying relevant ads
  • Targeting cookies: To show ads based on your interests

Functional Cookies

These cookies enhance website functionality:

  • Social media sharing buttons
  • Quiz result saving and sharing
  • Theme and display preferences

3. Third-Party Cookies

We use several third-party services that may set their own cookies:

Google Services

  • Google Analytics: Website analytics and reporting
  • Google AdSense: Advertising services
  • Google Fonts: Web font delivery

Journey MV

  • Advertising optimization and delivery
  • Revenue tracking and analytics
  • User behavior analysis for ad targeting

Social Media Platforms

  • Facebook and Twitter sharing widgets
  • Pinterest save buttons
  • LinkedIn sharing functionality

4. Cookie Duration

Cookies may be stored for different periods:

Session Cookies

These are temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser. They help maintain your quiz progress and security during your visit.

Persistent Cookies

These remain on your device for a specified period or until you delete them. Common durations include:

  • 30 days: User preferences and settings
  • 90 days: Analytics and performance data
  • 1-2 years: Advertising optimization data

5. Managing Your Cookie Preferences

Browser Settings

You can control cookies through your browser settings:

  • Accept all cookies: Default setting for full functionality
  • Block all cookies: May affect website functionality
  • Block third-party cookies: Prevents external tracking
  • Delete existing cookies: Clears stored data

Browser-Specific Instructions

  • Chrome: Settings → Advanced → Privacy and Security → Cookies
  • Firefox: Preferences → Privacy & Security → Cookies
  • Safari: Preferences → Privacy → Cookies and Website Data
  • Edge: Settings → Cookies and Site Permissions

Opt-Out Tools

  • Google Analytics: Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on
  • Digital Advertising Alliance: AdChoices Opt-out Tool
  • Network Advertising Initiative: NAI Opt-out Tool

6. Impact of Disabling Cookies

While you can disable cookies, doing so may affect your experience on PersonalitySpark:

Website Functionality

  • Quiz progress may not be saved between sessions
  • Theme and language preferences may reset
  • Some interactive features may not work properly

Personalization

  • Less relevant quiz recommendations
  • Generic advertising instead of targeted ads
  • Repeated display of content you've already seen

Analytics

  • We cannot improve our services based on usage patterns
  • Technical issues may be harder to identify and fix

7. Mobile App Considerations

If you use PersonalitySpark through a mobile app or web app, similar technologies may be used:

  • Local Storage: Similar to cookies but stored in app data
  • Device Identifiers: Unique IDs for advertising and analytics
  • Push Notifications: With your permission for updates and reminders

8. Updates to This Cookie Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, legislation, or our practices. We will notify you of significant changes by:

  • Posting the updated policy on our website
  • Updating the "last updated" date
  • Providing notice for material changes
